name: The Jane Austen Book Club Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who thought of the Jane Austen book club?
questions.explanation:
Jocelyn.

	Jocelyn thought of the idea for an all-Jane Austen book club. She picked the members by herself, which besides herself, were Bernadette, Sylvia, Sylvia's daughter, Prudie, and Grigg Harris. The prologue of the story began with who each member thought their Jane Austen was.

questions.text: What Jane Austen book was the first to be discussed?
questions.explanation:
Emma.

	Since the book club was Jocelyn's idea, she took the first meeting and picked the first book. Jocelyn picked "Emma" as the first Jane Austen book to be discussed. The others wanted "Pride and Prejudice", but with Sylvia's divorce being so new Jocelyn didn't think her friend could take a book about love and marriage.

questions.text: Sylvia's daughter was the second person to host the book club. What was her daughter's name?
questions.explanation:
Allegra.

	Allegra had her book club meeting at her mom's house where they discussed the second Jane Austen book, "Sense and Sensibility". She was the only daughter of Sylvia and Daniel Avila and she was gay. Almost every injury Allegra had ever incurred in her life, she lied to her parents about when it came to how she sustained the injury. Allegra broke up with her girlfriend, Corrine, after she found out Corrine was publishing the stories Allegra told her about things in her past.

questions.text: When Prudie's husband, Dean, took a "Sex and the City" magazine quiz, with which one of the actresses did he share a personality?
questions.explanation:
Miranda.

	While relaxing in the teacher's lounge at school one afternoon, Prudie found a "Sex in the City" personality quiz in the magazine she brought from home. Her husband Dean had filled out the quiz and it was revealed at the end of it that Dean was most like the character of Miranda.

questions.text: What was Grigg's favorite Jane Austen novel?
questions.explanation:
Northanger Abbey.

	Grigg wanted to host the book club meeting for "Northanger Abbey" because it was his favorite book. Grigg, the readers learn, was short for Gregory even though no one called him that and that he was in love with Jocelyn. He was also a fan of science fiction novels.

questions.text: What was the nickname Bernadette went by until she married her first husband, John Andretti?
questions.explanation:
Nettie.

	Bernadette had gone by the nickname Nettie until the day she married her first husband John Andretti and was called Nettie Andretti. From that day on she went by her full name Bernadette. They were married in a wedding chapel in Las Vegas.

questions.text: What Jane Austen book was the final book the club read?
questions.explanation:
Persuasion.

	"Persuasion" was read at Sylvia's house where Allegra had her book club meeting for the book "Sense and Sensibility". While they were in the midst of reading "Persuasion", Allegra had been admitted to the hospital for a fall at the rock climbing wall and the gang went to the beach with Grigg's sister Cat.

questions.text: Where was Bernadette when she met her present husband?
questions.explanation:
Costa Rica.

	Everyone gathered together to see the pictures of Bernadette's trip to Costa Rica and hear about her impending marriage. Bernadette told them that Senor Obanda was really the man for her and showed off her engagement ring.

questions.text: What was the last month the book club met, when they didn't discuss a book?
questions.explanation:
November.

	The book club met for the last time in November at a Bistro to have lunch and talk about Bernadette and her new husband. The reader also learned that Grigg and Jocelyn were dating and Allegra had broken up with the Emergency room doctor who took care of her after her fall and gotten back together with Corinne.

questions.text: Did Sylvia and her estranged husband reunite?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Daniel showed up at Sylvia's house during the book club meeting for "Persuasion". He asked if he could come back to live with her in the house. By the book's end, Sylvia and Daniel were dating again.
